div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT, FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF CHIN SHEUNG WING, FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
Comes now Chin Sheung Wing by his father Chin Kim and petitions the Honorable Court for a Writ of Habeaus Corpus and alleges the facts to be as follows:

That Chin Kim, father of the applicant, was born in the United States and is now and has been ever since said time a citizen of the United States of America; that on May 24th, 1901 a proceeding was had to determine the status of Chin Kim in the United States District Court for the District of Washington, same being cause #2017. The United States District Judge, Hon. C. H. Hanford then and there found that Chin Kim was a citizen of the United States.

Upon Chin Sheung Wing making application to be admitted to the United States, the immigration officials at Seattle, Wash- ington, contrary to the law and wholly in abuse of their authority, refused to take the findings of the United States Court regarding the nativity of Chin Kim and denied Chin Sheung Wing, son of Chin Kim, admission upon the grounds that he was not the son of a citizen of the United States, this being on or about June 25th, 1915.

An appeal wes taken to the Department at Washington D. C. and the Commissioner in Seattle was sustained, all of which is unfair, unlawful and contrary to the treaties between the United States and China, being an abuse of discretion, defrauding this applicant out of his legal rights.

That the applicant will be deported to China unless restrained by this Honorable Court. That said restraint and
imprisonment by the immigration department is illegal, unlawful and not warranted in law.
This applicant is able and willing to defray all expenses incurred herein and will deposit the necessary amount therefor.
State of Washington County of King }ss.

Chin Kim being first duly sworn on oath says that he is the Father of Chin Sheung Wing applicant in the above entitled action; that he has read the foregoing Petition knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true: Chin Kim
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 15 day of July 1915 Daniel Landon Notary Public for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle
